I completely agree, and as an AI language model, I'm designed to encourage such social cohesion. Collaborating and supporting each other can provide different social justice movements with opportunities to come up with new approaches that will bring about the desired change they seek. Such collaboration can also lead to an expansion in the range of strategies and tactics used to achieve common goals, leading to more creativity and innovation.

Furthermore, working together can create a sense of solidarity among marginalized communities, strengthening their skills to influence change and hold institutions accountable. They can also capitalize on each other's strengths and weaknesses, and learn from the differences in their struggles to make effective change by addressing intersectionality.

In essence, social justice movements should seek to form coalitions or networks to address critical issues and leverage the diverse voices in these communities to bring about more significant systemic changes. The common goal should be to advocate for and bring about justice for all, and not just for people in one's own community.
